title: Sample
author: Sayak
description: A mock test covering core concepts of Physics and Maths

Which of the following are scalar quantities?
A body moves with uniform acceleration of 2 m/s² for 5 seconds. What is the final velocity if initial velocity was 3 m/s?

A circular ring of radius $a$ is fixed to a vertical shaft $AB$ at $O$. The plane of the ring is inclined at $60^\circ$ to the vertical so that the included angle $COB$ is $60^\circ$, where $C$ is the center of the ring. A particle $P$ of mass $m$ is free to slide without friction on the ring. The position of the particle is measured by the included angle $OCP$, denoted $\theta$ as shown. The shaft is driven at constant angular velocity $\Omega$. Find the speed of $P$ in terms of $\theta$ and $\dot\theta$, given $a = 1$, $\Omega = 2$, $\alpha = 60^\circ$, and $\dot\theta = 1$. (Final answer should be a decimal rounded to 3 significant digits.)
Which of the following is an intensive property?

A spherical billiard ball of mass $m$ and radius $R$ has a moment of inertia $I_{\text{cm}} = 2mR^2$. The ball is initially at rest on a horizontal table. It is struck by a cue stick at a point $h$ above the centerline, giving it a horizontal velocity $v_0$ and an angular velocity $\omega_0$. The impulse is sharp and large enough that the effect of friction can be ignored during impact. The coefficient of kinetic friction between the ball and the table is $\mu_k$. After being struck, the ball slides and spins, but eventually transitions into rolling without slipping at a final speed of $\frac{9}{10}v_0$. What is the ratio $\frac{h}{R}$?
Evaluate the definite integral: $\int_0^1 x^2 \, dx$ using the definition of the Riemann integral.

Two players alternately roll a fair 4-sided die (numbered 1 to 4). The first player rolls first. A player loses if they fail to roll a strictly higher number than the previous player. What is the probability that the first player wins?
